page.title: 16Chaddleworth
page.content: Chaddleworth is a small village of some 350 inhabitants in a scattered community. The school is very old being one of the Oldest in the County. The church is of Norman origin and has some interesting features.It is situated close to Chaddleworth House which it predates considerably. The Rector for the area lives in nearby and has responsibility for 5 parishes. The village shop provides many things, groceries, post office, general stores and petrol station. The proprietor also runs the local taxi service. Many houses are a typical cottage style thatched roofs of brick and flint construction. There are some council houses as well as some modern houses & bungalows.Many people work on the land some have their own business & others work for the Americans at R.A.F. Welford where ammunition is stored.
